content: Negative / zero candles is not checked in tests, which leads to people passing 100% of test, but not validators.

I just played this clash and multiple people passed 100% of the given tests, but failed the validators. I updated tests 3 and 4 for you so that that the tests include the values 0 and 101. The validators tested these values, but the tests did not. The tests should be good now.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: fun to solve, love the reference

"You are given three numbers, n, t and c" seems incorrect and misleading.

In fact, there is 'n' which gives the number of following lines, and each line has two numbers 't' and 'c'.

That part should be rewritten I think.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: The game was fun and it is easy to understand.

"And there is no cake being more delicious than grandma's cake (t=101)"
The "t=101" is a bit ambiguous, wouldn't it be better to write "grandma's cake = 100" ?

Your contribution is good :) I liked it

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun and short clash, not to complicated!

Goal section
* Please change "n t and c" to "n, t and c", and change the full-stop there to a comma.

* Please delete the variable name x as it isn't used anywhere else in the statement.

Input section
* Please format BOTH line numbers in bold (e.g. <<First Line>>).

* Please change "input" to "integer".

* Please add "two space-separated integers" after "given".

Output section
* Please format "n lines" in bold.

* Please remove all the quotation marks.

Constraints section
* Please format all the variables.

* The ranges of possible values of n, t and c are too wide and do not reflect the actual cases. Please narrow down the ranges or modify the cases.

Cases
* Please revise the cases so that:
   â€¢ Each pair of test and validator is similar in terms of coverage.
   â€¢ t > 101 is covered in both tests and validators
   â€¢ more negative values are covered in both tests and validators.
   â€¢ strengthen the coverage of Validator 4.

Thanks.

Thank you for your feedback i've implemented some of your suggestions.
Also the x variable was meant to be t.
please tell me if there is anything else that confuses you  ;D

I wrote it that way, so people would struggle >:D
Jokes aside "grandma's cake = 100" doesn't tell what about grandma's cake is 100,
also the value is meant to be 101 to throw people of when they get to this part.
Thank you for your feedback and have a fantastic day :D
It only tells you that they exist, their order is specified in the input section.

Thank you for your explanation. The matters below still require your follow-up:

Constraints section
* Please format all the variables.

Cases
* Please include cases of t > 101 in tests. Currently they're covered in validators only.

Thanks again.

Thank you.
Please tell me if there is anything I have missed
Btw of you could rate this out of 10, what would your rating be? This is my first time making a puzzle.
